item.title: Pam add a quote by Jimmy Buffett
item.description: "If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane." -- Jimmy Buffett

item.title: Pam add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Pam add a quote by Leonard Nimoy
item.description: "The miracle is this - the more we share, the more we have." -- Leonard Nimoy

item.title: Pam add a quote by mahatma gandhi
item.description: "I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet." -- mahatma gandhi

item.title: Pam add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Pam add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Pam add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us. And the world will live as one." -- John Lennon

item.title: Pam add a quote by Georg Hegel
item.description: "We learn from history that we do not learn from history" -- Georg Hegel

item.title: Pam add a quote by Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
item.description: "Truth is found neither in the thesis nor the antithesis, but in an emergent synthesis which reconciles the two." -- Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

item.title: Pam add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "When pure sincerity forms within, it is outwardly realized in other people's hearts." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Pam add a quote by -Confucious
item.description: "<img src="Our greatest glory is not in never falling but rising every time we fall.">Our greatest glory is not in never falling but rising every time we fall." -- -Confucious

item.title: Pam add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "Worry is like a rocking chair: it gives you something to do but never gets you anywhere" -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Pam add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "The best moments in reading are when you come across something - a thought, a feeling, a way of looking at things - which you had thought special and particular to you. And now, here it is, set down by someone else, a person you have never met, someone even who is long dead. And it is as if a hand has come out, and taken yours" -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Pam add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami
